value.title: Make your Power BI Visual POP with this column header trick
value.excerpt: There are different ways to change column headers for a table or matrix visual in Power BI. Adam covers a few common ways and leave you with a trick to make the visual POP!   📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level?

value.title: My Excel file is in the cloud! Why isn't refresh working in Power BI???
value.excerpt: Pulling data from an Excel document in the cloud? Is your Power BI dataset not refreshing? Adam looks at why this could be the case and how to get it working.  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level? value.title: Populate a Power BI parameter list using a query
value.excerpt: Patrick shows you how to populate a Power BI parameter list using a query. This can help you avoid manually entering a list, or just having free text.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI Apps for multiple audiences has arrived!
value.excerpt: This has been a feature that has been asked for long time! The ability to control who can see what content within a published Power BI App! You can now serve up multiple audiences within a single app.  Announcing Public Preview of Multiple Audiences for Power BI Apps https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/announcing-public-preview-of-multiple-audiences-for-power-bi-apps/

value.title: Power BI slicers vs the filter pane (2021)
value.excerpt: What's the difference between Power BI slicers and the Filter pane? The filter panel can satisfy a majority of scenarios. There are a few that it can't. Which Power BI feature will you choose?  Slicer Panel: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xy9nmSQeUWg  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Power BI Tutorial | From Flat File To Data Model
value.excerpt: In this Power BI Tutorial, Patrick looks at how to load data from a flat file to the data model. This could be a text, csv or excel file with a lot of columns. Don't just pull it into Power BI. Take time to structure your data in your data model. From flat file to data model is basic concept, but is

value.title: Publish from Power BI Desktop for External Users
value.excerpt: Have you ever wanted to publish from Power BI Desktop to a different organization? External Users publishing!!! I show you how you can log in as an external user in Power BI Desktop and then publish. BANANAS!!!  Ross Couldrey LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/rosscouldrey/  Distribute Power BI content

value.title: Row-Level Security and Object-Level Security together in Power BI??? Yup!
value.excerpt: Struggling with using Row-Level Security (RLS) together with Object-Level Security (OLS) in Power BI? You think it can't be done? Think again! Patrick shows you how to use both together.  Announcement Blog: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/blog/object-level-security-ols-is-now-generally-available-in-power-bi-premium-and-pro/

value.title: Power BI Relationships: Step-by-Step Example (Slightly Advanced)

value.title: Count of Unique Values DistinctCount in Power BI Through Power Query Group By Transformation
value.excerpt: You can have a distinct count calculation in multiple places in Power BI, through DAX code, using the Visual's aggregation on a field, or even in Power Query. If you are doing the distinct count in Power Query as part of a group by operation, however, the existing distinct count is for all columns in

value.title: How to Do Power BI Mapping With Latitude and Longitude Only
value.excerpt: You can just use latitude and longitude to visualize data on the map. In this video, you will learn how you can do that with the map visual in Power BI. Read more and download the dataset from my blog article link here: https://radacad.com/how-to-do-power-bi-mapping-with-latitude-and-longitude-only

value.title: Power BI One Slicer to filter other slicers based on Items that has value only without BI Direction
value.excerpt: In a star schema design, how you can filter one dimension by another dimension. How you can find all the products that this customer purchased or all customers who have purchased this product using two separate slicers. To learn more about star schema: https://radacad.com/power-bi-basics-of-modeling-star-schema-and-how-to-build-it
